Fields.DialogueText: You're sure about that? I see. Thank you, Osono, that will... oh! Kanchou! Good timing.
You've upped your spy game again if you're using radios now. Where the heck is Osono, though?
Where I need her to be, of course. She'll return soon. This business was too important to trust to anyone else.
What business would that be?
I'll tell you as soon as I finish the analysis. In the meantime... I have another puzzle.
One I suspect you can help me with.
Why did Koku think he could possibly get away with what he was doing aboard me?

Fields.MenuText: The Army doesn't believe Belles exist. Or at least they don't understand you.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes... but perhaps this particular problem long predates our awakening.

Fields.MenuText: Someone was obviously feeding Koku some sort of narrative.

Fields.DialogueText: But to what end?

Fields.MenuText: Are the interservice rivalry games always this bad in Japan?

Fields.DialogueText: No, sometimes they get downright unpleasant.
Hmm. I need Osono's report. We haven't seen the last of this mess, that much is certain.
I... Kuso!
What?
Enemy ships inbound!
Get those planes in the air and get the escorts dancing!
@BATTLE
No quarter! Engage by squadrons!
@BATTLE
You look troubled. Something in Osono's report?
I simply find it disconcerting when someone doubts my existence, Kanchou.
The Imperial Army actually doubts the existence of Belles? Really?
To an extent, they believe ships have spirits, like any good Shintoist... and they'll obey the Imperial will.
But they can't help but feel Belles are extremely convenient for the Navy?
Precisely.

Fields.MenuText: Why do I feel like this is going to end up being a problem?
Honestly, I have a hard time believing a woman as beautiful as you could exist too.
Fighting a global land war between dozens of nations while facing an existential threat. Charming.

Fields.DialogueText: Because it almost certainly is, and an experienced officer should have a nose for that sort of thing.
Yamenasai Kanchou! It's not nice to tease ladies, you know!
It is, unfortunately, human nature.
Mhmm. And it's human nature that makes me think something is coming.
I'm sure you're right. Koku was a test, I think. Someone has learned from his failure.
Mhmm. My nose also tells me something worse is coming.
Is it teasing if it's sincere, though?
Anyway. I don't think this is over.
We'll just have to be ready for whatever they throw at us next.
Well, we have the first results of Koku's mischief, Kanchou.
A message from Kaigun-daisa Fukudo Keiji. Intelligence has verified him.
The Navy Ministry wants to make an actual inspection of the ship, and observe Belle carrier flight operations.

Fields.MenuText: I'm inclined to refuse. Koku had official paperwork too.
Maybe it's a legit inspection.
Hmm. Well, at least we'll know where the snake is once they're here.

Fields.DialogueText: We don't have the legal right to refuse, especially to a commissioned officer on active service.
And maybe I'm a delusional beauty who's merely obsessed enough with Kanchou to pretend to be flagship.
My thoughts exactly.
We'll need to prepare to deal with whatever their game is.
If there's a game to be played at all.
No, there's a game. There has to be. The ministry already looks poorly because of Koku.
They would not send another minion out so quickly without some underlying plan.
*ALARM*
One wishes the enemy would learn similar restraint.
@BATTLE
That's a lovely melody.
Ah, Kanchou - sumimasen! Did my playing disturb you?
Just the opposite, I found your songs refreshing.
Your praise honors me. I do love the shamisen - such a simple instrument, but with incredible potential in the right hands.
Playing makes me think of you, actually.

Fields.MenuText: Because I'm simple with incredible potential?
More than the sum of our parts - like a married couple, perhaps.
I see what you mean.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou! Don't tease me by saying such things. I was being serious.
Kanchou, you can't just...! My heart isn't ready for such flirting.
I thought you might.
You should play more often - it’s soothing. I’m sure the crew appreciates it too.
And, most important of all, it pleases me. Which is reason enough for any form of art to be practiced.
Well said. From the sword, to music or painting. It must do something for the one doing.
Unfortunately, I fear we shall have to continue this impromptu concert later.
We have enemy ships cresting the horizon. One of my retainers just spotted them.
Right, battle stations!
@BATTLE
I swear, the enemy are specifically primed to ruin any opportunity I have to relax!
Sounds like an excellent opportunity to let off a little steam, then.
By your order, Kanchou! Sei bai!
@BATTLE
I am singularly frustrated, Kanchou. Osono is too. Deadlocked at every turn.
So far all she's managed to dig up back in Tokyo involves a battleship construction project.
Japan is building new battleships?
Yes, I believe there's a planned class of four... They're like nothing the world has ever seen before.
They're massive beyond all previous sensible scales.

Fields.MenuText: Sounds like they're prefect for mauling Vanity and her ilk.
I would've thought Admiral Yamamoto would have had choice words about such things.
Outdated relics. We'll have to show the world what naval air power can really do.

Fields.DialogueText: If you want to brawl like thugs in the street, I suppose.
Oh, he did. He was overruled by the old fossils, it seems.
By your will, Kanchou.
Still, what could it possibly have to do with us?
Osono is returning soon? Maybe she'll have news she didn't feel comfortable transmitting.
Yes... Still. I'm very troubled by all this... we'll just have to piece it all together.
Kanchou? A word, if you please?
Of course, Akagi - close the hatch, take a seat. I always have time for you.
Gozaimasu. I have Osono's report. You were right. There was more.
We now know what this alleged inspection is for. To gather data to order a new class of carriers.
Interesting... and who's this Fukudo, then?
That's the interesting part. He's very much a real naval officer. He's spent his career in procurement and large surface combatants.
A battle wagon type, eh?

Fields.MenuText: Why would they send a battleship driver on a carrier research task?
Those new carriers not good enough for the combined fleet?
Curious... all sounds reasonable, and yet...

Fields.DialogueText: Theoretically any skilled procurement officer or naval engineer would do. In practice...
They are not even commissioned yet, Kanchou. But I can't imagine they won't be acceptable at least.
I feel it too. Something is very wrong here.
When does Fukudo arrive?
It should be tomorrow.
Then there's nothing for us to do now besides see what happens.
Well, not entirely nothing. Could I tempt you with some tea and sweets?
Yes, I think you could.
*ALARM*
Seems we have guests with different recreational ideas in mind.
Then let us go out and greet them properly.
@BATTLE
Kanchou! Kami-sama! Enemy raiders!
Blast and damn, the small craft carrying Fukudo is still out there!
Launch a strike package! No dignitaries are going to die on our watch!
@BATTLE
I suppose I must thank you for that timely rescue. Kanchou, Kami-sama.
It was our pleasure - right, Akagi?
We're just glad no harm came to you or your staff.
Yes, of course. You're a credit to the Imperial Navy, Kami-sama, and you an able guardian, Kanchou.
Excitement aside, I'd like to get my staff settled and get to work immediately.
Of course! Osono, if you'd show them where we have their billets.
Hai, Kami-sama. Kaigun-daisa, tadotte kudasai.
He seems perfectly normal. Perhaps I'm being paranoid...

Fields.MenuText: Honestly, your beauty distracted me from noticing anything.
Perhaps. I'll withhold judgement for now.
Make sure Osono investigates thoroughly.

Fields.DialogueText: You're such a tease, Kanchou!
Wise as always, Kanchou.
She will. Of that we can be entirely certain.
Come, let's have a little tea. Then check on our guests.
Sounds delightful - lead on.
Ah... finally a quiet moment.
Do I hear... shouting?
Kanchou! Have you seen this nonsense?
Dammit.
I demand to know who is responsible for all of this!
And I keep telling you, our aircraft handling is Imperial Japanese Navy standard.
To the absolute letter, I assure you.
Are you saying you know Imperial regulation better than I do?

Fields.MenuText: Considering she helped write those regulations...
Please remind me, Fukudo-san - you're a battleship officer, are you not?
I do believe that's exactly what she's saying.

Fields.DialogueText: Damn right I did! I shall not accept this slight to first carrier division's honor.
Yes, what would a battleship officer know about flight operations anyway?
I don't exactly hide my fangs like some mongrel.
Enough of this! The Navy Ministry will hear about this!
I swear he's trying to make that his catch phrase, like he's... a very specialized comedic actor.
Strange, I'm not laughing. What do you think is going on here?
I'm just not sure, Kanchou, Fukudo is either an idiot or very good at playing things close to his vest.
Huh. Where did you learn that phrase?
Many of the foreign sailors have been most helpful in teaching me words and phrases.
Some of them are quite apt in specific situations.
Care to share any more of your favorites?
I would enjoy that. In fact, an opportunity to do so is coming in quickly.
Especially for the shorter expletives.
*ALARM*
Daughter of a... Battle stations!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, I want permission to have Osono follow Fukudo.
That's a pretty aggressive move, Akagi. I have to ask, why?
No cause I can name. Yet.
Akagi...
Oh, fine! I think he's a spy. I'm not sure for who, but he and his minions are wandering all over.
They refuse to answer any questions when I prompt a crew member to probe them.
Even Osono has had a hard time listening in on them!

Fields.MenuText: Seems you've taken certain liberties with our guests already.
Really, she learned nothing at all?
Damn it, Akagi - these are dignitaries! We can't treat them like common smugglers.

Fields.DialogueText: Only to a point. I'm now at a stage where my concerns are serious enough to bring to you.
Some small bits of information. Either they're innocent or very good.
With all due respect, Kanchou, our last dignitary was a smuggler.
It's beside the point - it's clear to me that this is not a regular inspection.
I caught them measuring the spaces between rivets earlier!
Osono says she managed to read some of their notes as well. Gibberish, mostly.
What's in there, however, is a detailed picture of our flight operations.
Even suggested changes... both to ship and method. But the changes are all... wrong.
Wrong? Wrong how?
I'm not-
*ALARM*
Honestly, the worst thing about the Morganas are their atrocious manners.
@BATTLE
If they're taking notes for future carriers...
No, this behavior goes beyond that kind of mission.
Petty officer! Call for Akagi no Kami, please.
I am at your disposal, Kanchou.
Good. I want to finish our conversation regarding the notes Osono borrowed.
You said they were wrong. How exactly?
Well, for one, they recommend a port side island. Something the Navy ruled firmly against for the new Shoukaku class carriers.
While a port side island is perfectly functional, experience has shown that starboard side islands are perhaps easier to conduct flight operations with.
I hope it's not offensive to note that *you* have a port side island.
It simply means my pilots have to be more skilled than the others.
Why, exactly?
Aircraft have a tendency to pull to port.
The Imperial Japanese Navy experimented with them with the idea that by having paired carriers with opposite island structures, you could have opposing traffic patterns and reduce congestion.
And?
It didn't really work - hence, Shokaku and Zuikaku will have their islands on the starboard side, as likely will all Japanese carriers going forward.

Fields.MenuText: Hmm... so, an entirely new class of carrier?
Strange that it's all... wrong. With what justification?
A battleship officer... and carriers... hmmm. I wonder...

Fields.DialogueText: That does seem to be the idea.
They're reporting it as supported by field data. It won't be the only data the ministry takes into consideration, but...
You suspect factionalism has come into play? Perhaps... but there's other things afoot too...
Gah! I won't have this! No one plays spy games in my domain. Not without incurring my wrath.
I swear on the mountain my spirit was born on, I shall run these rodents to ground.
And the last thing they'll know of this incarnation shall be Osono's tanto!
Still... there's more here. An unseen enemy. Kanchou, I can feel it. I can feel... masaka. Kanchou! We need to go! Right now!
With allies like these, we should really convince the Morganas to cut us some slack. We have a full plate of enemies.
Less being witty, more getting to the bridge!
@BATTLE
Enemy ships on the horizon! Pilots! To your planes! Victory or a glorious death!
@BATTLE
I wish I smoked like some of the other Japanese kami. Or even in the more garish way of some of the Europeans and Yankees.
Why? Would it even do anything for you?
Not chemically, but I feel like it could be restful in a sense... calming. Meditative, perhaps.
Are you feeling disordered in some way?
Speaking plainly - as I do to none but you? Yes. Enemies within, enemies without... I think a focused Sedition's prowling around again.

Fields.MenuText: Now? Dammit!
I dearly wish these sea hags would stay in the shallow graves we keep digging for them.
...That makes sense, unfortunately.

Fields.DialogueText: Not quite that imminently, Kanchou.
All the world wishes that with you, Kanchou.
Indeed... she must adore such infighting and intrigues amongst her enemies.
I'm letting myself get a bit flustered. I shouldn't be. There's only a small group of potential spies, and the usual oni trash.
I can handle this, and I will. I certainly won't let filth like Sedition get the better of me.
Kanchou, I'm going to be sending some of my retainers on little missions. I'll be using some of the discretionary funds.
Do what you have to do, Akagi. I trust you.
Your trust warms my heart, Kanchou. Now... shall we enjoy some of the post battle calm properly?
Kami-sama, Kanchou, I've come with tea and some sweets.
One day I'll figure out how you do that, Osono.
Respectfully, Kanchou - no, I assure you, you won't. Now, do enjoy.
Don't try to understand Osono, Kanchou - some mysteries are too great even for me.
So you don't know what her deal is either?
Mayhaps, but let's talk of other things.
Ah. Playing the shamisen today, Akagi?
Yes, I've been neglecting my hobbies and simple joys for the games of my inferiors... they scurry in my hull like mice, and now my cats hunt them.
It falls to me only to wait for their success - instead of micromanaging my talented warriors and servants.
You seem upset.
What possibly could make you believe that?
Well, that white-knuckle grip and the grimace on your face are kind of suggestive. Plus, you don't normally use terminology like "inferiors."
It's Fukudo. He sent a coded message from my own radio room!
That's normal enough for a senior navy official.
With an army code.
Oh. That's a bit different.
I suspect he's mocking me.

Fields.MenuText: Is he really mocking you? Or is he just ignorant?
He seems like the type who'd be more direct with mockery.
Being that blatant with his intrigues? What else could it be?

Fields.DialogueText: Perhaps both.
True, he is rather arrogant, even for a Japanese officer.
My thoughts exactly.
I had to restrain myself from ordering Osono to crush him.
My frustration... Someone wants me to be frustrated. Upset. When someone wants you upset it is very much in your interest to be calm.
It might be Fukudo's masters... but I suspect it's Sedition, or those like her, taking advantage, as we suspected.
We'll have to deal with both of them. Sooner rather than later.
Not to worry, I'm already preparing to sink my thorns into the lot of them.
Osono's tanto in Fukudo, and my lovely retainers' bombs and torpedoes into Sedition.
*ALARM*
... Speaking of opportunities to utilize my weapons.
Potentially quite relaxing.
Indeed. Orders?
Do you even need to ask? Load antiship weapons, and launch aircraft!
@BATTLE
Mist sighted! Morgana raiders inbound!
Bring us about, into the wind, and get those planes in the air!
Right where I want you. Let us crush them.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, I just had a very unsettling thought.
Fukudo, he has something in common with that smuggler trash. He believes he can operate with impunity aboard me.
My honor demands I be outraged at the sheer gall of such beliefs.
My concern, however, is that these foolish men must be getting this belief from somewhere.

Fields.MenuText: Could they be indoctrinated agents of the Morganas?
Hmm. Perhaps some sort of rival organization in Japan's military, jealous of the prestige the Kami brings.
If I had 1 sen for every time someone underestimated a Belle I could buy the INPF a new capital ship.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, the possibility has crossed my mind.
That would be ever so ridiculous, Kanchou. Or... rather, it should be ridiculous.
Or fine gifts for all your loyal Belles, of course. You hardly need another capital ship when you have me.
Yes, this bears further concern and increased security... but it must be done without letting them know.
The second they realize we're on to them, they'll flee to their rat holes.
We need to relax them. Get them stupid.
We make an announcement about increasing the alcohol ration due to increased combat tempo.
Crew will receive more, but nothing too strong. Fukudo and his crew, however...
We'll give them the strongest sake I can procure.
This is getting entertaining, Kanchou. The game is afoot!
Quickly, now. I want those rumors planted amongst the crew before the next watch.
Ryoukai, Kami-sama.
Did I just hear you plotting with Osono, Akagi?
Ah, Kanchou! Me? Plot? Hardly! I'm such a sweet and innocent young woman.
Akagi...
Oh, boo! You're no fun. Fine. I'm plotting. Specifically, I'm laying bait for Fukudo.
I can't tell you more, Kanchou, the less you know the better your reactions will be if it comes up.

Fields.MenuText: I'm suddenly extremely concerned, Akagi. Why is that?
I don't like where this is going already.
Anything I can do or say in the meantime to add to the illusion?

Fields.DialogueText: Because you're a distrustful soul who can't rely on your subordinates acting in good faith?
Oh, but I assure you that you'll enjoy the destination, even if the journey is in the dark.
Pretend to write in this notebook for long periods of time, somewhere public, while looking thoughtful.
I'll tell you what it is soon. Just remember to deny everything when the time comes.
Now that business is dealt with, could I interest you in a bit of recreation, Kanchou?
I know you're just trying to distract me.
Well, yes. But the incoming Morgana ships are very real.
Dammit, Akagi, lead with that next time! Petty officer! Battle stations!
Aye aye, Captain!
*ALARM*
I think a little exercise is just what I needed!
@BATTLE
Kanchou? Sumimasen. Do you have a moment?
Of course, Commander. I always have time for my crew.
There's an unsettling rumor going around about some sort of report on Japanese carrier aviation.
What kind of report?
I'm not sure of the details, only what I've managed to overhear from the sailors.
The gist appears to be that... that you and other officers have authored a report damning Japanese carrier aviation, and the Akagi class in particular.
And that the report details quite literally everything wrong with the IJN system and battle tactics. Or, rather, it seems to say that everything *is* wrong.

Fields.MenuText: Who in the blackest depths would do that?
Dammit! This kind of story could be a disaster for the INPF if it spreads.
Who would benefit from something like that? The Imperial Army, maybe... or...

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, as I say, the rumors attribute it to one of our own senior staff, even sometimes to you!
An unparalleled diplomatic incident.
Is now really the time to be considering that, Kanchou?
Blast it all to...
Huh.
Kanchou?
Shōsa, this conversation never happened. Do you understand me? Now return to your post!
Ryoukai. Sumimasen!
I rather like Shōsa Tachimoto, but the man's a terrible liar.
All part of your plan, I take it?
Very good, Kanchou. I have offered them all manner of bait, and now Shōsa Tachimoto will appear to be hiding something.
A touch mean to the commander.
He is serving the Emperor to the best of his abilities, and I have no doubt he will help deliver the Emperor's enemies to my hands.
You still won't be explaining yourself, will you?
No. No, I will not, Kanchou. Play along just a bit more. You're doing marvelously.
*sigh*
Fine. Just make it...
*ALARM*
Ye gods and little fishes, today never ends.
All in good fun, Kanchou. Come, an air strike will improve your mood for certain.
@BATTLE
Wind over the bow... all aircraft! No quarter, no surrender, and no ships escape our wrath! Launch!
@BATTLE
There you are, Kanchou.
Here I am. Were you looking for me?
Yes. I am always somewhat aware of my crew, and you in particular.
With a little focus I am aware of all those within me. From the smallest mouse to you.
But today I thought I might find you without the aid of my special senses. It was enjoyable.
I almost felt what I imagine being human is like for a moment.

Fields.MenuText: Wait, hold it. You're omniscient?
One can only imagine how you abuse that power.
Why would you ever not use that ability?

Fields.DialogueText: To a limited degree, and only within my hull, but yes.
Oh, mostly just to play pranks and make sure no one's slacking on watch.
To sharpen my own skills, of course.
... And, in a melancholy mood, I sometimes wonder who I might be if I had been a mother-born human, not a kami.
So you could theoretically hunt down fugitives aboard perfectly?
Can - and have, if you recall. It's hardly a theory, merely fact.
I've also used it to find lost or misplaced items, contraband, and three stowaways.
Can't imagine anyone desperate enough to stow away aboard a warship.
Children. Two were separated from refugees we were evacuating, the other fell asleep in a crate of supplies.
The former are with their families, the third was put ashore and into the care of Osono's family in her home village.
That's nice of her kin - where's she from?
Mie prefecture, somewhere near the city of Iga.
Iga, huh? You don't say...
Enough about such dusty matters, I'm about to go on a walk to tend my roses. Care to join me?
Sure, I'll join you, Akagi. Thank you for the invitation.
I’d recognize this stench anywhere. Battle stations! We have a rat to crush.
@BATTLE
Damn that little wretch! Ooh. I’m almost glad she manages to come back so I have the pleasure of sinking her again.
I didn’t know you had that much distaste for Sedition specifically.
Kanchou, you should know better than that. Flower arrangement, and spy craft, are all the imposition of order upon chaos... and Sedition is chaos. Very noisy chaos.
Besides... she’s been reaching her tendrils out towards the fleet. I had suspected, but now I’m sure.
She’s broadcasting messages to the fleet, trying to ensnare the minds of wayward sailors.

Fields.MenuText: That’s unacceptable, Akagi. Deal with the situation.
What? Why? Is there a specific plot, or this is just general Morgana shenanigans?
... You know, I can’t help but notice her timing is very convenient.

Fields.DialogueText: Ryoukai wakarimasen, Kanchou. I have dealt with her, and I shall again.
I cannot say for certain... I believe it might be a bit of both.
I agree completely. I suspect Sedition is lured to her namesake like a moth to flame... now we must ensure she burns.
I am taking steps to handle this matter. Her communications will not be allowed to go unimpeded... and I’ll be keeping Fukudo and his ilk away from the hangars.
Do it subtly. Have some of the trusted sailors lead them around by the nose... maybe using that report.
Can I ask what you’re doing? What's the endgame?
You may ask, Kanchou... but I must ask you to trust me in this matter, as I shall not answer. I can only promise it will not affect strike capability.
... All right, Akagi. I trust you.
Captain to the bridge! Repeat! Captain to the bridge! All hands to action stations.
Damn!
Good timing Kanchou. I’m turning into the wind, and an antiship strike package awaits your orders.
... I’m not seeing any hint of the enemy out the portholes, nor on the plotting board.
We haven’t found them just yet. Allow me. Radio room! Transmit “Rakurai!”
Kami-sama! Taka flight acknowledges “Rakurai.”
I thought we’d launched more than the usual patrol aircraft earlier.
I took the liberty of specially modifying some of my retainers with the most powerful radios we could safely fit, and triangulation equipment.
To what end...?
Kanchou! Kami-sama, signal coming in - it’s Sedition.
I can't make it out.
Intentionally on my part. It’s her usual low effort attempt to “brainwash” our sailors. Drivel, really. Now we just... ah. I can feel the telegraph coming in.

Fields.MenuText: I’m still lost.
Aha... Taka flight, your hunting falcons.
So, what’s the next stage of your plan?

Fields.DialogueText: Not to worry, Kanchou - all shall be made clear.
Correct. Most adroit, Kanchou.
You give the order to crush them, of course.
Transmit Raijin to Taka flight - we know where she is, now we silence her noise and crush her.
The order is given.
Get those coordinates plotted!
You heard the lady! Get the fleet moving and launch the first wave!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, Captain Fukudo is here to see you.
Send him in.
Kanchou-sama, I’ll be brief. I want that report you wrote.
Yes, Captain, it’s good to see you as well, do sit down. Would you like a cup of ocha, perhaps?
I have little patience for your games - including the games of that woman you have playing the “spirit” of this ship.
And I haven’t the damndest idea of what you’re talking about... and I suggest you watch your language regarding my ship.
Because you’ll do something about me?
Hardly - she’ll handle it herself. You’re only human, after all.
You persist with this strange delusion that she is not?

Fields.MenuText: You seem to want to ignore reality, Minister.
You dare to question the Imperial will?
How do you explain the Morganas, then?

Fields.DialogueText: How dare you!?
I dare defend the Imperial will from those that would defraud it!
I... probably an American trick. The Western powers have always coveted Asia.
Enough of this! Give me the report on carrier aviation.
*ALARM*
I don’t have the slightest clue what the hell you’re talking about. Now get out of my way.
I have a war to win, and if you slow me down I promise I’ll toss you overboard with the rest of the trash - and that, Fukudo-san, is a promise.
@BATTLE
Launch Taka flight! Pilots, to your planes!
We might not be able to kill Sedition permanently yet, but that’s no reason to let her be on the right side of the waves for long. Attack!
@BATTLE
Honestly, I don’t think I’ll ever get tired of watching through one of my retainers as a dive bomb rips into Sedition’s hull.
The blossoming flames make me reach for my clippers so I can start arranging flowers almost automatically.
Not that you're obsessed or anything.
The term, my dear Kanchou, is "passionate." I... oh. Osono!
Gah! Where the... never mind. I think I’m getting used to that.
I shall endeavor to be more mysterious, Kanchou.
Kanchou, Kami-sama, Taka flight intercepted a radio transmission on their way back from the last battle. They waited until they landed to report it.
Let’s see the report... yes. It’s good they waited. Another transmission using Army codes. Fukudo reporting to his masters, no doubt.
Hai. Thankfully, we have this particular code broken. Kami-sama... Kanchou... the message includes the phrase “scuttling charges.”

Fields.MenuText: Scuttling charges? What the hell is Fukudo thinking?
Akagi. Do I even need to say it?
Why the hell are we standing here, then? Crush them.

Fields.DialogueText: I’m sure he can be induced to explain himself.
No, Kanchou, I know exactly what must be done.
Hai, Kanchou - by your command.
Osono, hunt them all down.
They have made threat to this ship and its crew. You will take prisoners where possible, those who resist shall receive no quarter. Unless... Kanchou?
I agree completely. Get them all in the brig. Any that resist are shark bait. Except Fukudo... we need him alive.
Ah, Kanchou - good timing. Fukudo is just about to be pulled out of his rat hole. There is no hiding from a Belle in her own hull.
Yeah, well. He's very clearly confused about certain things about Belles.
So much for his samurai honor. You'd think he’d stand and fight like a man.
Mistress, he’s in this crate, as you said.
Crowbars. Open it up. There! Bind him! Get him on his feet.
Captain Fukudo, a pleasure to see you again.
How did you...
You’re a fool, that’s how. I don’t know how in Tenma’s realm you thought you could hide from a kami in her own hull, but really. It’s insulting.
Bah! You’re just some actress pulled off the streets and dressed up.
I know the truth of you lot now - the Army was most helpful in that regard.
And once my agent passes on that thrice-damned report of yours, Kanchou, we’ll at last return to the battleship navy we were destined to be.

Fields.MenuText: I can’t decide if you’re deluded, an idiot, or are just that blind.
There is no report, you fool. It was bait!
That’s what this is about? More budget for battleships?

Fields.DialogueText: Is "all of the above" a possibility?
Honestly, I’m shocked you didn’t figure it out sooner.
If that’s all it takes to sway him, then he’s more pathetic than I thought.
Enough of this. Toss him in the brig.
I want every drop of information about his Army contacts. If they want a war, then by all means we’ll give it to them.
At once, Kanchou, Kami-sama.
You won’t get away with this! Damn you both!
*ALARM*
Osono, carry him if you have to. Akagi-
Right away, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
So, what have you got, Akagi?
I searched his quarters, and found all manner of documents, They mostly concern battleships - specifically, the design A-140F6 ships.
What little I found on carriers was quite dismissive of naval air power as a weapon of war.
These battleship designs are insane.
Kanchou! Transmission from a small boat nearby - it's announcing itself as commanding Admiral, INPF-Japan!
Right. Get the admiral aboard, quickly!

Fields.MenuText: Well, now. That’s unexpected.
Maybe the Admiral will have some answers for us.
What fresh hell is this?

Fields.DialogueText: It is. I admit I didn’t account for this.
Perhaps, or at least some new questions.
Only one of the more interesting ones.
The admiral is aboard, Kanchou!
Excellent. Let's-
Morgana raiders - they're closing fast!
Must have been laying in wait nearby. Get the admiral below, battle stations!
@BATTLE
Admiral, it’s a pleasure to have you aboard.
It’s a pleasure to be aboard. I was skeptical of the INPF, Kanchou, but you are clearly treating Akagi with the dignity due an Imperial Japanese warship.
I could ask for no better or more honorable commander.
Let’s get to the business at hand, shall we? I believe you have a naval officer of mine in the brig presently... with charges of treason leveled against him.
That’s correct, Admiral.
Good, I was hoping the two of you would be quick witted enough to to preempt whatever that rodent was up to when I sent him your way.
What was he up to, anyway?
Basically, he was attempting to sabotage the next generation of Japanese carriers in the name of more battleship funding.
Exactly as I suspected, then. I'd say, more specifically, he wants money and resources for the second pair of Yamato class ships.
And for the design A-150 ships, which will theoretically be the successors to the Yamato class.

Fields.MenuText: We saw the designs for the Yamatos, they’re... massive. Beyond massive.
I can only see him as a man mired in the past. I respect my battleships, but...
Honestly, the man’s completely insane if he thinks this will help his cause.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, the largest warships designed by human artifice... and do keep that between us.
Indeed, carrier warfare is the way of the future. Any officer with vision can see it.
Most succinct, Kanchou. I agree completely.
While I have hopes for Yamato, Musashi, and any other ships of that class in light of our new circumstance with the demons from the sea...
I suspect Admiral Yamamoto was correct when he described them as “Like elaborate religious scrolls that old people display in their homes.”
*ALARM*
I believe you have business to attend to. We’ll continue this later.
@BATTLE
Let’s put on a good show for the admiral, everyone! Launch all aircraft! Sei bai!
@BATTLE
Admiral! I demand that you confine these two immediately!
As if I could confine a ship aboard herself! How dare you demand anything, Fukudo?! Working with the gods-cursed Army?
Who else are you a spy for, you damned fool?
I just wanted to...
I know all about the battleships! How will internal strife in the Navy and intentionally damaging the next carriers serve your cause?

Fields.MenuText: Never mind exposing Japan to the enemy.
Why in the world you’d think the IJA would be at all interested in helping you...
Even if it did help, you’re a fool if you think the IJN and INPF don’t need carrier air power to win the day.

Fields.DialogueText: Exposing all of humanity, really. The crime is threefold at least.
Hmph. Disgusting. Can’t win the proper way, so beg for aid from one who despises us.
Well said, indeed.
Maybe I... was a bit hasty. Admiral, I’ll apologize if you demand it of me.
If apologies were sufficient in times of great failure, then we wouldn't have seppuku. Perhaps you might reflect on that as you return to Tokyo with the admiral.
I’ll even give you a tanto.
Seppuku... if I must die, then I’ll take you to hell first, abazure!
Osono! Sei bai!
*slash*
Artfully done, young lady. You didn't even get any blood on the rest of us.
My art, my duty, and my honor are one, Admiral-dono. I must clean this mess up. Shitsureishimasu.
I believe that concludes our business here. I have a heavy cruiser coming to pick me up and take off the prisoners. You have my thanks, and the thanks of the Emperor.
You can say that again, my friend.
No, I think once will suffice, Kanchou. But, if you enjoy the sound of my voice so much, I can indulge you on other topics.
Thank you for inviting me, Akagi. I feel like we could both use a moment to relax.
Indeed... I’ve been thinking about everything that’s happened.
I’m deeply concerned about Fukudo... someone was feeding him information, pulling his strings. Someone who was giving him very detailed misinformation about Belles.

Fields.MenuText: I wonder how much his source actually knows.
I hate intelligence games. They need to fight more honorably.
The Kempetai, huh? Guess we couldn’t rely on them to stay in Manchuria.

Fields.DialogueText: Either too much or not nearly enough. I’m not sure which.
Hmph. You like them well enough when I’m playing them.
Most pestilences have a habit of spreading themselves.
Well. There’s nothing to do about it today.
Osono! Could you fetch more tea and your shamisen?
At once, Kami-sama! I’ll bring some snacks as well.
Intending to stay down here for a while?
Yes. Actually, I was hoping you’d join me.
We haven’t had a chance to simply sit and enjoy the ocean for a while.
Haven’t had much of a chance to talk, either.
Thank you for joining me in the rose garden, Kanchou.
Then let us talk, and savor some tea and snacks. Enjoy some music.
In a time of war, moments of peace must be found... and cherished.
